title: 104_hr543
content: The Act titled "National Marine Sanctuaries Preservation Act" is being amended to reauthorize funding for the National Marine Sanctuaries Act. Authorization of appropriations is specified for fiscal years 1997 to 1999. Additionally, a management, recovery, and preservation plan for the U.S.S. Monitor is included. The Secretary of Commerce is required to prepare a comprehensive plan for the management, stabilization, preservation, and recovery of artifacts and materials of the U.S.S. Monitor within 12 months. The plan should utilize resources from other Federal and private entities with expertise. Additionally, there is a provision for the publication of notice of certain advisory council meetings. SEC. 5 amends Section 315(e)(3) by exempting Advisory Council meetings for individual national marine sanctuaries from Federal Register publication. SEC. 6 enhances support for national marine sanctuaries. Section 316 of the National Marine Sanctuaries Act is amended by redesignating and moving existing provisions, with subsections being struck and redesignated. The Secretary is granted authority to establish a program within the Act. In subsection (a)(5), "establishment" is replaced with "solicitation" and "fees" with "monetary or in-kind contributions." In subsection (a)(6), "fees" is replaced with "monetary or in-kind contributions," "paragraph (5)" is replaced with "paragraphs (5) and (6)," "assessed" is replaced with "collected," and "in an interest-bearing revolving fund" is removed. In subsection (a)(7), "fees" is replaced with "monetary and in-kind contributions," and "and any interest in the fund established under paragraph (6)" is removed. In subsection (a), paragraphs (5), (6), and (7) are redesignated as paragraphs (6), (7), and (8), with a new paragraph added regarding the creation and selling of products to promote the national marine sanctuary program. Monetary and in-kind contributions raised through the sale of related products will support individual sanctuaries. In subsection (e), paragraph (2) is removed. In subsection (a), paragraphs (5), (6), and (7) are redesignated as paragraphs (6), (7), and (8), with a new paragraph added regarding the creation and selling of products to promote the national marine sanctuary program. Monetary and in-kind contributions raised through the sale of related products will support individual sanctuaries. In subsection (e), paragraph (2) is removed. In paragraph (1), subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), and (D) are redesignated as paragraphs (1), (2), (3), and (4). In paragraph (3), "fee" is replaced with "monetary or in-kind contribution". In subsections (b), (c), and (d), "subsection (b)" is changed to "subsection (a)". SEC. 7. Hawaiian Islands National Marine Sanctuary. The Hawaiian Islands National Marine Sanctuary Act is amended to include Kahoolawe Island waters within the Sanctuary upon request from the Kahoolawe Island Reserve Commission. The Secretary will determine the suitability of including the marine environment within 3 nautical miles of Kahoolawe Island in the Sanctuary. The Secretary will determine if Kahoolawe Island waters are suitable for inclusion in the Sanctuary. If deemed suitable, the Secretary will notify the Governor of Hawaii and prepare necessary documents for inclusion. If the Governor objects within 45 days of the management plan issuance, the Secretary will take appropriate action. If the Secretary deems the management plan, regulations, or terms unacceptable, they will not take effect in the Hawaii Sanctuary area. The Secretary may terminate the designation if the policy or purposes of the title cannot be fulfilled. Notice of termination must be given to relevant committees. If the Governor objects within 45 days, appropriate action will be taken. The Governor of Hawaii can certify to the Secretary that the inclusion of Kahoolawe Island waters in the Sanctuary is unacceptable, in which case the inclusion or related terms will not take effect for 3 years. The Secretary may terminate the inclusion if it affects the policy or purposes of the title. The Sanctuary Act is amended by redesignating section 2307 as section 2308 and adding a new section after section 2306. The Secretary is prohibited from implementing user fees for activities within the Hawaiian Islands National Marine Sanctuary or its resources. The term 'user fee' excludes certain fees authorized by the National Marine Sanctuaries Act. Additionally, there is a modification to the Flower Garden Banks boundary. The boundaries of the Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary are amended to include Stetson Bank. The area will be managed as part of the sanctuary and the Secretary of Commerce will prepare a chart depicting the modified boundaries. The Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary boundaries are expanded to include Stetson Bank, as depicted on a specific map and within a certain depth, with regulations to be implemented by the Secretary of Commerce. The Secretary of Commerce may make minor adjustments to the boundaries of the Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary to protect coral resources and simplify administration, without significantly altering the size or restricting oil and gas activities. The Secretary of Commerce will publish a notice in the Federal Register describing the boundaries of the Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary and any necessary modifications to regulations. This notice will fulfill the requirements of the National Marine Sanctuaries Act. Amounts may be appropriated under section 313 of the National Marine Sanctuaries Act for this section. SEC. 9. MISCELLANEOUS TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS. Section 301(b)(2) of the National Marine Sanctuaries Act is amended by inserting a semicolon. Section 302 is amended by adjusting punctuation in paragraphs 6 and 7. Section 307(e)(1)(A) is amended by adding "of 1980" before the period. Sections 2109 and 2110(d) of the National Marine Sanctuaries Program Amendments Act of 1992 are also amended. The Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1972 was amended by the National Marine Sanctuaries Program Amendments Act of 1992. Various sections were added and amended, including the insertion of "or authorize" after "undertake" in section 312(b)(1). Additionally, section 2202(e) was amended by changing "section 304(e)" to "304(d)." Section 304(b)(3) of the National Marine Sanctuaries Act is amended by removing subparagraphs (B) and (C), adjusting the formatting of subparagraph (A), and renumbering clauses (i) and (ii) as (A) and (B) respectively. SEC. 10. Northwest Straits in Washington must have specific authorization by law for designation as a national marine sanctuary under the National Marine Sanctuaries Act. SEC. 11. Stellwagen Bank National Marine Sanctuary renamed as the "Gerry E. Studds Stellwagen Bank National Marine Sanctuary".
